description._content: Description: Saint Pierre. Street scene. The objects in the foreground are corpses in a heap (about 16). Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. Interior of the Colonial Bank. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. West Tower Cathedral. The Bell is in the Belfry frame on the ground. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. Quebec S.S. Co's "Roraima" burning off St Pierre, 11th May 1902. She disappeared on the 16th May. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 11 May 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. Taken from a boat about 300 yards from the shore. (11th May). Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 11 May 1902 Description: St Pierre from the Sea. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. The Cathedral taken from near the Altar looking Westwards. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. Wreckage in the Foreshore. Cathedral Tower in the distance. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. A corpse in the wreckage on the foreshore. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. The Lighthouse and wreckage in the foreshore. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: On the Quay. Saint Pierre. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. Street scene. Military hospital with a clock at 7.50 at end of street. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Description: Saint Pierre. The safe at the Colonial Bank. Location: Saint Pierre, St Vincent and Martinique Date: 1902 Our Catalogue Reference: Part of CO 1069/388 This image is part of the Colonial Office photographic collection held at The National Archives, uploaded as part of the Caribbean Through a Lens project. We have attempted to provide place information for the images automatically but our software may not have found the correct location. We need your help to fill in the gaps, to unearth the missing stories, the social and cultural memories from this selection of colonial recordings. Do you recognise anything or anyone in the photographs? Do they provoke any personal or historical memories? If so, please leave your comments, tags and stories to enrich our records. If you would like to get involved in our community project Caribbean through a lens, we would love to hear from you. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library
